jx.jx_cn_mean: 全神贯注于：完全沉浸于或专注于

lj.lj_ly: She is wrapped up in her studies.
They were wrapped up in criminal activities.

entry.def: When you wrap something, you fold paper or cloth tightly round it to cover it completely, for example in order to protect it or so that you can give it to someone as a present.

example.ex: Harry had carefully bought and wrapped presents for Mark to give them...
example.tran: 哈里精心购置了礼物又仔细包好，让马克交给他们。

example.ex: Mexican Indians used to wrap tough meat in leaves from the papaya tree.
example.tran: 墨西哥印第安人过去常用番木瓜树叶把难嚼的肉包起来。

entry.def: Wrap is the material that something is wrapped in.

example.ex: I tucked some plastic wrap around the sandwiches to keep them from getting stale.
example.tran: 我用塑料包装纸把三明治裹起来，防止变质。

entry.def: When you wrap something such as a piece of paper or cloth round another thing, you put it around it.

example.ex: She wrapped a handkerchief around her bleeding palm...
example.tran: 她用手绢将流血的手掌包扎起来。

example.ex: Then she stood up, wrapping her coat around her angrily...
example.tran: 然后她站了起来，怒气冲冲地穿上大衣。

entry.tran: 用(手臂、指头或腿)围紧;用…绕住
entry.def: If someone wraps their arms, fingers, or legs around something, they put them firmly around it.

example.ex: He wrapped his arms around her.

entry.def: A wrap is a piece of clothing which women wear round their shoulders, either to keep them warm when wearing an evening dress, or for decoration over a coat.

entry.tran: 保密，秘而不宣（常指待日后宣布）
entry.def: If you keep something under wraps, you keep it secret, often until you are ready to announce it at some time in the future.

example.ex: The bids were submitted in May and were meant to have been kept under wraps until October...
example.tran: 标书5月份递交，本欲10月份才予以公布。

example.ex: The date and venue of the game must remain under wraps...
example.tran: 比赛的时间和地点必须保密。

2. a sandwich in which the filling is rolled up in a soft tortilla
3. the covering (usually paper or cellophane) in which something is wrapped

Sentence.sentence: And of course when you go out, you'll wrap up warm.
He tells the story of a patient, a first-time mother who complained that her young son was always clinging to her, wrapping himself around her legs wherever she went.
And of course when you go out, you'll wrap up warm.
